intro: I am a Sydney-based software engineer passionate about building and evolving reliable systems quickly. During my career, I have developed front-ends, back-ends and ops automation projects for e-commerce, accounting and social networking sites. I am deeply passionate about automation and continuous delivery as I have seen them applied to greatly reduce impact of project risks (e.g. missing deadlines or breaking on manual deploys). I love working with energetic teams that want to move fast and ship amazing products. My tools are React, Go, Node.js, Terraform, ConcourseCI and AWS.

projects.name: seneca-amqp-transport
projects.description: Official AMQP transport plugin for Seneca. This plugin allows seneca listeners and clients to communicate over AMQP.

projects.name: twelvejs
projects.description: Utilities to assist in building 12Factor apps.

projects.name: mongoose-encrypted
projects.description: Mongoose plugin and schema type for working with encrypted data.

projects.name: mongodb-oplog-publisher
projects.description: Daemon that watches mongodb oplog and publishes events to RabbitMQ.

work.description: I am helping build an identity provider for use in verifying people's identities when attempting to access online government services. This role places heavy focus on applying modern technologies such as **React, Redux and Go** to build reliable and accessible services for **all** Australian citizens.
highlights: Develop an accessible front-end using **React (Create React App)** and **Redux**
Develop back-end APIs using Go and Gin web framework
Build an automated test harness with accessibility testing using **TypeScript**, **WebdriverIO**, **Cucumber** and **aXe**
Attended frequent user testing sessions that help my team and I improve the usability of our service
Work in a kanban-style, 2-week sprints and present at company-wide showcases
…and a lot more to come!

work.description: As a development lead at MYOB, my role carries a lot of responsibilities within my team and across the greater group of around 270 MYOB developers. My team consists of 6 developers and QA analysts that work on Tax Online - an online service for managing and lodging tax obligations used by both SME clients and tax agents in the ANZ region.
highlights: Develop the technical roadmap for our project alongside our feature roadmap

Develop in our codebases just like all the developers in my team, introduce **Docker** and **AWS ECS** to assist in developing and deploying micro-services quickly, review pull requests and coach team members on coding standards and quality

Introduce continuous delivery practices by deploying and migrating to **ConcourseCI** from our previously abandoned GoCD snowflake server (built by contractors that have since left). We have seen a great increase in reliable deployments every day since its introduction.
AWS infrastructure automation using **Terraform** and improving our logging, monitoring and alerting practices by using tools such as **Bunyan, Splunk, NewRelic, AWS CloudWatch and Pagerduty**
Contribute to and maintain the company's shared stylesheet and [React widgets](https://myob-technology.github.io/myob_widgets/) project
Take part in working groups to develop company standards for our ops, front-end and back-end practices. These revolve around our use of AWS, Terraform, React and Node.js
Hold **regular one on one meetings** with my team members to give them feedback and directions and discuss their thoughts about our work.

Help my team apply principles of agile development by holding regular **sprint planning sessions**, **inceptions**, **retrospectives** and **pulse checks** with the clear aim of giving them the ability to self-determine the course of our project.
Encourage a culture of learning and development by **hosting regular knowledge sharing sessions** and **design and architecture workshops**.

work.description: I joined The Ticket Fairy, an events management platform, as its first developer. I worked on building the next version of the platform using modern and open tools.
highlights: Redeveloped the main site with new brand identity
Built an overhauled events management dashboard for events organisers using React, Redux and AdminLTE

Created a link shortener using Go and RethinkDB similar to bit.ly. It allows users specifies to setup multiple links of which one is chosen randomly or based on a visitor's country (uses MaxMind GeoIP2)
Deployed and managed a Mesosphere + CoreOS cluster that runs a small set of dockerized services. It was intended to support more and more services as they are developed.

work.description: I was the first developer at Alphatise (https://www.alphatise.com/) and the only back-end developer since the start of the company. I built the platform’s back-end from the ground up as several Node.js services and designed the CoreOS + Docker production deployment. As a director, I am responsible for advising the business in matters relating to evolving the platform with new features: effort required, complexity and return on investment of features.
highlights: Designed, implemented and documented all APIs for the platform using Node.js + CoffeeScript, Express, Kue, Socket.io, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis and Apiary.

Applied 12 factor methodology to create stateless services with nice configuration and logging and awareness of connected services. I created a library and open sourced it based on the concepts called [twelvejs](https://github.com/disintegrator/twelvejs)
Managed first production deployment on Rackspace

Moved production environment to AWS with fully dockerised node.js services running on CoreOS. All services were redundant, providing a good level of availability. This allowed us to roll out features very rapidly (almost daily and at least once every week).
Hired and lead the front-end teams (web and native) to deliver the Alphatise tech platform

work.description: I joined Booodl (http://booodl.com) on the basis that I would help introduce front-end development experience into their front-end team (consisting of a junior developer and a formerly back-end developer). Soon after joining and proving my skills, I was made the lead front-end developer.
highlights: As the lead, I scope out sprints, allocate tasks to my team and deal extensively with design and product teams to contribute design and technical insights
My role also involved mentoring the other developers, reviewing their code and managing its delivery via pull requests

Set up the development stack for the dev team using Backbone.js + Marionette.js wrapped in Require.js. Styling is done with SASS/SCSS using BEM (block, element, modifier) semantics. This is all built and bundled up using grunt.js.
I introduced testing using karma, mocha, chai and sinon
Developed an internal style guide for our site (kind of like bootstrap).

work.description: I was the only developer employed at Pollen handling all the development for new business since my arrival. My role required that I posses a range of development skills (or, in some cases, acquire them very quickly) in order to deliver projects within very short time frames.
highlights: Front-end and back-end development. Some of the projects I worked on are: Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel (http://lordnelsonbrewery.com/), Woolworths Christmas 2012, Various HCF micro-sites which are no longer published and many white sites, prototypes and email templates for various clients
Work closely with designers to ensure pixel perfect, responsive websites and in general inform them where technology constraints or opportunities are present
Responsible for researching and picking the tools that best suit every new job we get

work.description: I worked at brandsExclusive - an online retailer - as a Python-based web developer. The company operates a site that is written in Django for the most part.
highlights: Worked closely with web designers to deliver new features on the main sites (http:// www.brandsexclusive.com.au/ and https://www.livingexclusive.com.au/) as well as with the rest of the developers to fix bugs and issues that appear from time to time.
On the front-end, I was responsible for developing the theme that is presented on brandsExclusive and livingExclusive.
Developed an iOS app to go with a bluetooth handheld scanner for use as a logistics tool at the warehouse.
Developed the live feed on the brandsExclusive site that was backed by Node.js, Socket.IO and Redis
Briefly involved in the development and maintenance of the brandsExclusive iPhone app
